entity1.name: Space Exploration
entity1.description: The discovery and exploration of outer space, including the Moon, planets, and other celestial bodies.;;;The investigation of celestial bodies and space beyond Earth's atmosphere, often involving the use of spacecraft.;;;Organized efforts or programs aimed at exploring outer space using spacecraft and other technologies.;;;The vast, mostly empty expanse beyond Earth's atmosphere where celestial bodies such as stars, planets, and moons exist.;;;A series of space probes launched by NASA to study the outer Solar System and interstellar space.;;;The investigation of celestial bodies and outer space using spacecraft, telescopes, and other technologies.;;;The discovery and investigation of celestial bodies and the space environment using spacecraft, satellites, and other technologies.;;;The investigation of celestial bodies and the universe using spacecraft, telescopes, and other scientific instruments.;;;The discovery and investigation of celestial bodies and phenomena that occur outside Earth's atmosphere.
entity1.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future1;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future15;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future20;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future9;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future3;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future17;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future7;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future21;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future22;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future2

entity2.name: World
entity2.description: The planet Earth, specifically referring to all its countries and regions collectively.
entity2.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future1

entity3.name: satellites
entity3.description: Artificial objects launched into orbit around the Earth or other celestial bodies for various purposes such as communication, navigation, and research.
entity3.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future2

entity4.name: planets
entity4.description: Large celestial bodies that orbit a star and do not produce their own light.;;;Large celestial bodies that orbit a star and have sufficient mass to be nearly round in shape due to their own gravity.
entity4.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future20;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future2

entity7.name: Soviet Union
entity7.description: A former federal socialist state that existed from 1922 to 1991, known for its role in the Cold War and space race.;;;A former country that existed from 1922 to 1991, comprising 15 republics and was known for its significant role in global politics and space exploration.
entity7.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future5;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future4

entity8.name: Sputnik 1
entity8.description: The first artificial satellite launched by the Soviet Union on October 4, 1957, marking the beginning of the space age.
entity8.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future4

entity9.name: United States
entity9.description: A country in North America, known for its significant contributions to technology and space exploration.
entity9.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future5

entity11.name: space race
entity11.description: A competition between the United States and the Soviet Union during the Cold War to achieve superior spaceflight capability.;;;A 20th-century competition between the Soviet Union and the United States for supremacy in spaceflight capability.
entity11.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future5;;;Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future20

entity12.name: Yuri Gagarin
entity12.description: The first human to orbit the Earth in 1961.
entity12.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future6

entity13.name: Neil Armstrong
entity13.description: One of the first humans to walk on the moon as part of the Apollo 11 mission in 1969.
entity13.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future6

entity14.name: Buzz Aldrin
entity14.description: One of the first humans to walk on the moon as part of the Apollo 11 mission in 1969.
entity14.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future6

entity15.name: Apollo 11
entity15.description: The space mission that landed the first humans on the moon in 1969.
entity15.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future6

entity17.name: Mars rovers
entity17.description: Robotic vehicles sent to Mars to explore its surface, gather data, and conduct scientific experiments.
entity17.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future7

entity18.name: International Space Station (ISS)
entity18.description: A habitable artificial satellite in low Earth orbit, serving as a microgravity and space environment research laboratory.

entity19.name: 1990s
entity19.description: The decade from 1990 to 1999, during which significant advancements in international space cooperation occurred.

entity23.description: A private American aerospace manufacturer and space transportation company founded by Elon Musk.;;;A private American aerospace manufacturer and space transportation services company founded by Elon Musk.

entity24.name: reusable rockets
entity24.description: Rockets designed to be used multiple times, reducing the cost of space launches compared to single-use rockets.
entity24.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future10

entity25.name: ISS
entity25.description: The International Space Station, a habitable artificial satellite in low Earth orbit used for scientific research and technological development.
entity25.chunkid: Space Exploration: Past, Present, and Future11

entity26.name: Mars
entity26.description: The fourth planet from the Sun in the Solar System, known for its reddish appearance due to iron oxide on its surface.;;;The fourth planet from the Sun in the Solar System, known for its reddish appearance and the subject of numerous space missions.

entity33.description: The fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in the Solar System.

entity34.description: The sixth planet from the Sun and known for its prominent ring system.

entity35.description: Planets outside our solar system that have conditions potentially suitable for life.

entity36.name: solar system
entity36.description: The collection of planets, moons, asteroids, comets, and other objects orbiting the Sun.;;;The collection of celestial bodies, including planets and the sun, that are gravitationally bound to our star, the Sun.

entity39.description: A field that encompasses the development and application of technologies for space exploration and utilization.

entity40.description: A type of spacecraft propulsion system that uses electric fields to accelerate ions, providing efficient thrust for long-duration missions.
